Key Match Events: Gerrit Cole pitched four scoreless innings before allowing a hit.
Aaron Judge, Jazz Chisholm Jr., and Giancarlo Stanton hit home runs.
Tommy Edman's liner led to Aaron Judge's first error in 1,958 career innings as a center fielder.
Freddie Freeman hit a two-run single and Teoscar Hernández hit a two-run double to tie the game.
Tommy Kahnle allowed all three men he faced to reach in the eighth inning, contributing to the Yankees' loss.
Alex Verdugo struck out swinging through a Walker Buehler knuckle curve to end the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Aaron Boone expressed optimism about the team's potential to 'shock the world'.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed regret over his error and the impact it had on the game.
Anthony Volpe reflected on the team's performance and their belief in their ability to win the World Series.
Aaron Judge mentioned that falling short in the World Series will stick with him for life.
